perturbation.original_text: MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on each member’s fair share of the deficiency. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.
perturbation.changed_text: MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine if an extra payment is needed. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'It will be based on each member’s fair share of the deficiency' the method of calculating the 'extra payment' is omitted, creating ambiguity. The contract still states an extra payment may be required, but the basis for calculation is removed, leading to uncertainty about how the 'fair share' would be determined. While the rest of the maintenance of solvency clause remains, the removal of this specific part undermines the clarity and enforceability of the entire clause, especially since the Board now determines if the payment is needed without a specific calculation method.
